derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in sense 2): shortening of Old French esquier 'esquire'

entry.def: In former times, the squire of an English village was the man who owned most of the land in it.

entry.tran: 先生(有些男性对不相识的同性友好的尊称)
entry.def: Some men use squire to address a man they do not know in a friendly but respectful way.

means.word_mean: 1. young nobleman attendant on a knight
3. a man who attends or escorts a woman
1. attend upon as a squire; serve as a squire
